wastrel: that crontab line is fine, though specifying /1 is silly -- it's implied.
what to you mean /1??
your first field is "*/1".  The "/1" is unnecessary.  Also using absolute paths is generally a good idea in crontabs, so replace sh with /bin/sh

can i get it to output everything??
e.g the .sh says run pisg, and pisg outputs some text

yes, when you redirect a program, all its children inherit the redirection.  So all commands run by the script are also redirected.  I note that you didn't redirect STDERR, though.  You probably should.  Do it like this: ... >>/home/bassetts/myfile  2>&1
